citation.article-title: Fangia hongkongensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel gammaproteobacterium of the order Thiotrichales isolated from coastal seawater of Hong Kong
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Fangia (Fan′gi.a. N.L. fem. n. Fangia named after Professor Xinfang Fang, founder of the Institute of Microbiology of the Chinese Academy of Sciences).
Gram-negative, short rods to coccobacilli, occurring singly or in pairs, non-motile.
Strictly aerobic, chemoheterotrophic, requiring sodium or potassium ions and organic growth factors such as yeast extract for growth.
Catalase-positive; positive or weakly positive for oxidase.
Predominant fatty acids are a-17 : 0, a-15 : 0 and 18 : 1ω9c.
Phylogenetically, Fangia is a member of the order Thiotrichales.
The type species is Fangia hongkongensis.
